image.altText: A young fair man wearing a chain on the beach

props.synopsis: Brad Balzan died a violent death in his own backyard. Some are calling it "the worst outcome imaginable of proactive policing".

title.children: Police stopped Brad on his morning walk for wearing a hoodie. Ten minutes later, he was dead

image.altText: A modern building with a large sign reading 'Royal Flying Doctor Service' is framed by eucalyptus leaves.

props.synopsis: In a remote town where people often have to receive healthcare at the pub, the opening of a nation-first 24/7 Royal Flying Doctor Service centre has left station workers and William Creek residents celebrating.

title.children: 'Game-changing' 24/7 telehealth service lands for outback community via unstaffed RFDS building

image.altText: Pierre Ricot looks stern standing amid the rubble of his home after it was torched by gangsters

props.synopsis: The Caribbean nation of Haiti is plunged into anarchy as powerful and violent gangs overrun the besieged capital, displacing hundreds of thousands.

title.children: An island nation taken over by gangs: This is what life is like under Barbecue's reign

image.altText: A blonde woman in a black shirt with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Blindsided staff and out-of-pocket customers speak out after Canberra day spa Adytum entered liquidation.Â

title.children: Audrey closed the doors of a Canberra day spa at 4pm. Within hours, she had lost her job and was facing deportation

image.altText: woman sitting on cardboard box.

props.synopsis: TV series Expats has re-opened a conversation about the slave-like conditions of domestic helpers, mostly women from the Philippines and Indonesia, working for Hong Kong's rich.

title.children: Invisible, forced to live with your boss, then tossed onto the street: Welcome to life as a domestic worker in HK

image.altText: A box forÂ the ordering of candidates in South Australia's First Nations Voice to Parliament elections.

props.synopsis: Voting has closed across South Australia for the state's inaugural First Nations Voice to Parliament election, with a result not expected until the end of March.

title.children: Polls close in South Australia's inaugural First Nations Voice to Parliament election

image.altText: The Inflatable Church taped.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old Adelaide man is charged with property damage after allegedly damaging The Inflatable Church in Adelaide's CBD.Â

title.children: Knife-wielding man allegedly damages premiere inflatable Adelaide Fringe show venue

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz standing behind the podium looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Let me guess, you've finally gotten the hang of this trivia thing and you've come back for more? Well, let's see what you've got.

title.children: Call yourself a trivia whizz? Prove it. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A woman with black sunglasses standing on a street smiling and carrying a black bag

props.synopsis: The lowest fertility rates in the world are seen in East Asian populations such as South Korea and Japan. But rates are even declining in countries like China and India. Why are women in these countries choosing to be child free?

title.children: Why are women in countries with the lowest fertility rates not having kids?

image.altText: A graphic shows pictures of Marc Mietus and relevant vehicles involved in the cold case.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old set off for Queensland in the first week of the new millennium in search of a fresh start. Detectives believe he was murdered before the month was out.Â

title.children: Marc Mietus picked up a hitchhiker at a NSW truck stop in January, 2000. Two weeks later, he vanished

image.altText: Smoke rises following an Israeli airstrike in the central Gaza Strip, Friday, March 15, 2024.

props.synopsis: International mediators had hoped to secure a six-week truce before Ramadan started earlier this week, but Hamas refused any deal that would not lead to a permanent ceasefire in Gaza, a demand Israel rejected.

title.children: Ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas expected to restart, Egyptian officials say

image.altText: Lara Alexander, John Tucker and Jeremy Rockliff.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian MPs who quit their parties mid-term could be forced to leave parliament all together under a new Liberal proposal to "restore stability and certainty" to the state's parliament.

title.children: Will a 'stability clause' solve Tasmania's disgruntled pollie problem?

image.altText: Man with fair skin and orange beard wears white shirt and white hard hat in front of contstruction site

props.synopsis: Sheikh Shadi Asuleiman is Australia's first home-grown imam and the changing face of Islam here.

title.children: Sheikh Shadi is Australia's first home-grown imam. It's not the only 'first' he wants to achieve

image.altText: Mural of a woman and children with a rainbow

props.synopsis: The Elsie Women's Refuge Night Shelter was formed in 1974. Its founder reflects on unwelcome male visits, lessons learned and the "community attitudes" that still need to change on its 50th anniversary.

title.children: How a group of women claimed squatters' rights in two vacant homes to set up Australia's first women's refuge

image.altText: Construction site sign at Rocklea State School which is undergoing works after being flooded in February 2022

props.synopsis: A tragedy at a gold mine in Ballarat this week has shone the spotlight on industrial manslaughter laws, and the low rates of convictions in Australia.

title.children: Why are convictions over workplace deaths so rare in Australia?

image.altText: Tracey Price, Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner and Greens candidateÂ Jonathan Sriranganathan.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner has been re-elected to the city's top job, while the LNP looks set to win the Ipswich West by-election amid a significant swing away from the state Labor government.

title.children: LNP retains Brisbane City Council and on track to snatch Ipswich West by-election from Labor

image.altText: A photo of a rooster on a patch of grass on a suburban street

props.synopsis: I didn't mow down Elvis with my car, but I can't escape the fact my empathy toward a rooster ignited the ire of people who felt compelled to end his life.

title.children: Who killed Elvis the rooster and why does it matter? The surprising link between empathy and cruelty

image.altText: A Nepali man with a scar on his face

props.synopsis: A document leaked to the ABC shows a worrying number of Nepalese men have joined the Russian army. But some appear to have been lured into Putin's war under false pretences.

title.children: The alleged scam luring Nepali men to Russia â only to drop them on the battlefield in Ukraine

image.altText: A pink piggy bank sits on a pile of Australian money

props.synopsis: Having an idea about the average super balance in Australia for your age can help you take the necessary steps to boost any shortfall.Â

title.children: How much super should I have and am I behind the average balance for my age?

image.altText: A woman stands smiling in front of a rack of clothes and a table with dozens of football boots on it.

props.synopsis: When Taylah Power's son grew out of his third pair of footy boots in the span of a year, she knew she couldn't be the only parent looking for a cheaper way to get children through sport.

title.children: As the cost of living goes up, this mum is helping parents get kids sports gear for free

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The man was in custody for 58 days for breaching a family violence order which was not in force at the time.

title.children: Man fails in bid to sue ACT courts over claims of wrongful imprisonment

image.altText: A Geelong AFL captain lifts a teammate in the air as two other players celebrate next to them after a vital goal.

props.synopsis: Geelong leaves it late to clinch a win over St Kilda at a completed Kardinia Park, while the Suns withstand a late surge by the Crows, following earlier wins for the Giants and Bombers.

title.children: Dangerfield gets Cats home in thriller over Saints as Suns hold off the Crows

image.altText: Jakara Anthony after winning the dual moguls event at the Deer Valley World Cup meet in 2024.

props.synopsis: Jakara Anthony caps off one of the greatest seasons in any winter sport in brilliant style, with the Australian freestyle skier sealing an incredible 14th World Cup moguls win in her 2023/24 campaign.

title.children: Olympic champion Anthony completes glorious season with 14th World Cup win

image.altText: Jasper Philipsen pips Michael Matthews in Milan-San Remo finish.

props.synopsis: In the fastest edition of the Milan-Sam Remo race, Michael Matthews finishes mere centimetres behind winnerÂ Jasper Philipsen, falling just short of his first victory inÂ the prestigious one-day Monument.

title.children: Aussie Matthews pipped in 'bittersweet' Milan-San Remo photo finish

image.altText: a cooked barramundi fillet on rice in a bowl.

props.synopsis: Northern Australia's commercial wild-caught barramundi industry says it's in a fight for its future as concerns are raised about the sustainability of certain fishing methods.

title.children: Wild-caught barramundi is a dining table favourite, but can it continue?

image.altText: Millie looks to the left with a worried expression and a cut on her face as she stands alone in a dark room.

props.synopsis: Here's what's new to streaming, heaps good and out now â from two very different period dramas and The Gentlemen adaptation, to Kate Winslet's latest foray into the small screen, and a searing documentary about life in Gaza.

title.children: Millie Bobby Brown is anything but the damsel in distress in her new feminist fantasy mockbuster

image.altText: A souped-up black car outside a building that says Silverton Souvenirs.

props.synopsis: Clunes in Victoria hides its fictional alter ego well with a main street lined with bookshops, quaint cafes, and electric vehicles. It's one of numerous country towns that have had a brush with Hollywood.

title.children: You wouldn't think it to look at them, but Australia's country towns have had their Hollywood moments

image.altText: The Princess of Wales pictured with her children Louis, George and Charlotte in a photo some believe has been manipulated

props.synopsis: It's hard to believe that a sweet photo of the Princess of Wales and her children could have turned into such a fiasco for Kensington Palace.Â But what is really going on, asks Juliette Rieden.

title.children: The damage to the monarchy from the manipulated photo is real

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell runs with the ball for the SOuth Sydney Rabbitohs in an NRL game against the Brisbane Broncos.

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell's repeated F-bombs in a post-match interview prompt NRL boss Andrew Abdo to remind players of their responsibilities when speaking to the media.

title.children: NRL wants players to 'be authentic', but Latrell Mitchell's on-air swearing prompts reminder about 'responsibility'

image.altText: A row of white self-service kiosks at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Together, McDonald's mobile app, its self-serve kiosks and its digitised menus enable the company to eke out additional sales and efficiencies worth billions of dollars to the company. Yet that same technology can also bring McDonald's to its knees.

title.children: McDonald's has no plans to slow high-tech transformation, as it blames global outage on third party

image.altText: A sign knocked down by flood water

props.synopsis: Food is running out at a remote Goldfields community and an emergency helicopter is the only way relief can get in after dramatic flooding over the past few days.

title.children: Helicopter flies to remote WA community as flood-hit residents call for medical help, food supplies

image.altText: Red car accelerates at Westfield Liverpool Myer into the beauty counters

props.synopsis: Police say they were told a teenager was sitting in the red electric SUV which was on display inside a Sydney shopping centre before the car accelerated forward, smashing glass panels, and reversing into the Myer store.

title.children: Display car reverses into Myer shopfront at Sydney Westfield with 14yo boy inside, two men injured

image.altText: A woman on a medical gurney in a plane

props.synopsis: The Kimberley was WA's busiest region for the Royal Flying Doctor Service last year, airlifting patients like Ella whose waters broke while she was travelling in a truck in the outback.

title.children: 'What are the chances?' How this young mum's holiday saw her rushed across the outback to give birth
